title: Why Sarah Ferguson will make royal history when Princess Beatrice marries
text:
From Harper's BAZAAR

Princess Beatrice and Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi announced their engagement earlier this week but it's the Duchess of York who will make the royal history books when the couple say "I do".

Although the soon-to-be newlyweds have yet to confirm details of their forthcoming nuptials, it's widely speculated that they will tie the knot in a Church of England ceremony at St George's Chapel in Windsor.

According to Royal Central, by the time the couple wed - Princess Beatrice will walk down the aisle in 2020 - major changes will have been made to the way in which the church records marriages.

In one of the biggest changes to marriage law in over a century, the mother-of-the-bride will now be listed on the certificate for the first time. Currently, only the names and job occupations of the bride and groom's fathers are listed.

Therefore, the Duchess of York will become the first royal mother-of-the-bride to be listed on a wedding certificate.

The age-old law was altered earlier this year in order to allow opposite sex couples to enter into civil partnerships which were first introduced back in 2005 for same sex couples.

News of Princess Beatrice and Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi's engagement was announced by Princess Eugenie via Instagram on Thursday (September 26).

The 29-year-old posted a series of photographs of the happy couple alongside a statement from the pair: "We are extremely happy to be able to share the news of our recent engagement."

"We are both so excited to be embarking on this life adventure together and can't wait to be actually married. We share so many similar interests and values and we know that this will stand us in great stead for years ahead, full of love and happiness."

The engagement ring was handcrafted by British designer Shaun Leane at his atelier in Mayfair and co-designed by the groom.

The royal made her first public appearance with her now fiancé in March at a gala at the National Portrait Gallery in London. The pair have been dating since last September, but have been friends for a number of years.
